TEMPORARY Retrieve the Staging Path for a Dataset

Source: R/helpers_ext.R
pa_ds_stageing_path_get.Rd

This function retrieves the full staging path for a given dataset within a functional area, removes any single quotes from the path, and returns the directory path.

Usage

pa_ds_stageing_path_get(.staging, .functional_area, .dataset_name)

Arguments

.staging

A character string specifying the staging level (e.g., `"bronze"`, `"silver"`, `"gold"`, `"platinum"`).

.functional_area

A character string indicating the functional area (e.g., `"sales"`, `"master_data"`).

.dataset_name

A character string specifying the dataset name.

Value

A character vector containing the cleaned directory path for the specified dataset and staging level.

Details

This function:

  • Calls .fh_dataset_paths_get to retrieve the dataset's full path.

  • Removes single quotes using gsub("'", "", .) to ensure a clean file path.

  • Extracts the directory path .

The function automatically determines the active environment using .hl_config_get()$project$active_environment.

See also

.fh_dataset_paths_get, path_dir

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{

# Retrieve the path for the "rtp" dataset in "bronze" staging level for the "sales" functional area.
path <- pa_ds_stageing_path_get(
  .staging         = "bronze",
  .functional_area = "sales",
  .dataset_name    = "rtp"
)
print(path)

} # }
